title: Enable MFA For Work / P(privileged) Account

storage.value:
Microsoft Azure: Microsoft MFA Enrollment Options


Refer to this article to guide you through setting up Microsoft Authenticator on your cell phones.

For Your Information

  • Microsoft MFA (Multi Factor Authentication) is used in order to access Azure Portal (https://portal.azure.com)  (Notifications MUST be enabled for Authenticator App to work properly)

  • The accessing of Azure portal with Single Authentication will be disabled soon & MFA will be enabled from March 15, 2025. Azure Portal users are required to move to a more secure authentication method using Microsoft Authenticator.

  • Customers must be logged in to the HCSC network in order to setup the Microsoft Authenticator app from the Microsoft "Security info" page.

  • For the latest documentation please review: Set up the Microsoft Authenticator app as your verification method - Microsoft Support

Perform the Following Steps

  • Sign in to https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info using your HCSC Email Address and Password.

Note: If you don't see the Security info page, go to Additional security verification, then select the checkbox next to Authenticator app, and then select Configure to display your QR code.

  • Select + Add sign-in method.

  • Choose Authenticator app from the dropdown and select Add.

  • If you already have Authenticator installed on your phone, select Next to display a QR code.

  • Open Authenticator on your phone and select the plus icon + and select Add account.

  • Select Work or school account then tap Scan a QR Code.

Note: No action required, if you already have setup Authenticator for MFA then it can be validated as shown in the below picture.


Report an issue:

If these steps did not resolve your issue, report your issue from the service portal for support.
